permafrost.tundra.lang

Class StringHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • permafrost.tundra.lang.StringHelper

  • public final class StringHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of convenience methods for working with String objects.

      • truncate

        public static java.lang.String truncate(java.lang.String input,
                                        int length)
        Truncates the given string to the given length. If the string length is less than or equal to the desired length it is returned unmodified, otherwise it is truncated to the desired length.
        Parameters:
        input - The string to be truncated.
        length - The length to truncate the string to.
        Returns:
        The truncated string.

      • truncate

        public static java.lang.String truncate(java.lang.String input,
                                        int length,
                                        boolean ellipsis)
        Truncates the given string to the given length. If the string length is less than or equal to the desired length it is returned unmodified, otherwise it is truncated to the desired length.
        Parameters:
        input - The string to be truncated.
        length - The length to truncate the string to.
        ellipsis - If true, the returned string is suffixed with an ellipsis character when truncated.
        Returns:
        The truncated string.

      • truncate

        public static java.lang.String[] truncate(java.lang.String[] input,
                                          int length,
                                          boolean ellipsis)
        Truncates the given strings to the given length. If a string's length is less than or equal to the desired length it is returned unmodified, otherwise it is truncated to the desired length.
        Parameters:
        input - The strings to be truncated.
        length - The length to truncate the strings to.
        ellipsis - If true, the returned strings are suffixed with an ellipsis character when truncated.
        Returns:
        The truncated strings.

      • truncate

        public static java.lang.String[][] truncate(java.lang.String[][] input,
                                            int length,
                                            boolean ellipsis)
        Truncates the given strings to the given length. If a string's length is less than or equal to the desired length it is returned unmodified, otherwise it is truncated to the desired length.
        Parameters:
        input - The strings to be truncated.
        length - The length to truncate the strings to.
        ellipsis - If true, the returned strings are suffixed with an ellipsis character when truncated.
        Returns:
        The truncated strings.

      • pad

        public static java.lang.String pad(java.lang.String string,
                                   int length,
                                   char character)
        Pads a string with the given character to the given length.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to pad.
        length - The desired length of the string. If less than 0 the string is padded right to left, otherwise it is padded from left to right.
        character - The character to pad the string with.
        Returns:
        The padded string.

      • pad

        public static java.lang.String[] pad(java.lang.String[] input,
                                     int length,
                                     char character)
        Pads each string in the given list with the given character to the given length.
        Parameters:
        input - The list of strings to be padded.
        length - The desired length of the strings. If less than 0 the strings are padded right to left, otherwise they are padded from left to right.
        character - The character to pad the strings with.
        Returns:
        The list of padded strings.

      • compare

        public static int compare(java.lang.String string1,
                          java.lang.String string2)
        Compares two strings lexicographically.
        Parameters:
        string1 - The first string to compare.
        string2 - The second string to compare.
        Returns:
        Less than 0 if the first string is less than the second string, equal to 0 if the two strings are equal, or greater than 0 if the first string is greater than the second string.

      • compare

        public static int compare(java.lang.String string1,
                          java.lang.String string2,
                          boolean caseInsensitive)
        Compares two strings lexicographically.
        Parameters:
        string1 - The first string to compare.
        string2 - The second string to compare.
        caseInsensitive - Whether the comparison should be case insensitive.
        Returns:
        Less than 0 if the first string is less than the second string, equal to 0 if the two strings are equal, or greater than 0 if the first string is greater than the second string.

      • compare

        public static int compare(java.lang.String string1,
                          java.lang.String string2,
                          boolean caseInsensitive,
                          boolean whitespaceInsensitive)
        Compares two strings lexicographically.
        Parameters:
        string1 - The first string to compare.
        string2 - The second string to compare.
        caseInsensitive - Whether the comparison should be case insensitive.
        whitespaceInsensitive - Whether the comparison should be whitespace insensitive.
        Returns:
        Less than 0 if the first string is less than the second string, equal to 0 if the two strings are equal, or greater than 0 if the first string is greater than the second string.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.util.Locale locale,
                                      java.lang.String pattern,
                                      com.wm.data.IData[] arguments,
                                      com.wm.data.IData scope)
        Returns a formatted string using the specified pattern and arguments.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale to apply during formatting. If null then no localization is applied.
        pattern - A format string, as per http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/Formatter.html.
        scope - An IData document which contains the argument values referenced by the given argument keys.
        arguments - The list of arguments to be fetched from the record and normalized to the specified types.
        Returns:
        A formatted string.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.util.Locale locale,
                                      java.lang.String pattern,
                                      com.wm.data.IData[] arguments,
                                      com.wm.data.IData scope,
                                      int index)
        Returns a formatted string using the specified pattern and arguments.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale to apply during formatting. If null then no localization is applied.
        pattern - A format string, as per http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/Formatter.html.
        scope - An IData document which contains the argument values referenced by the given argument keys.
        arguments - The list of arguments to be fetched from the record and normalized to the specified types.
        index - The zero-based array index for this record if it is part of a list that is being formatted.
        Returns:
        A formatted string.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.util.Locale locale,
                                      java.lang.String pattern,
                                      com.wm.data.IData[] arguments,

                                      com.wm.data.IData scope)

        locale - The locale to apply during formatting. If null then no localization is applied.
        pattern - A format string, as per http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/Formatter.html.
        pipeline - The pipeline against which absolute argument keys are resolved.
        scope - An IData document which contains the argument values referenced by the given argument keys.
        arguments - The list of arguments to be fetched from the record and normalized to the specified types.
        Returns:
        A formatted string.

        public static java.lang.String format(java.util.Locale locale,

        pipeline - The pipeline against which absolute argument keys are resolved.
        scope - An IData document which contains the argument values referenced by the given argument keys.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.util.Locale locale,
                                      java.lang.String pattern,
                                      com.wm.data.IData[] arguments,
                                      java.lang.String recordSeparator,
                                      com.wm.data.IData... records)
        Returns a formatted string produced by formatting each given record using the specified pattern and arguments, separated by the given separator string.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale to apply during formatting. If null then no localization is applied.
        pattern - A format string, as per http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/Formatter.html.
        arguments - The list of arguments to be fetched from each record and normalized to the specified types.
        recordSeparator - An optional string for separating each formatted record in the resulting string.
        records - An IData[] document list where each item contains a set of argument values.
        Returns:
        A formatted string.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.util.Locale locale,
                                      java.lang.String pattern,
                                      com.wm.data.IData[] arguments,
                                      com.wm.data.IData pipeline,
                                      java.lang.String recordSeparator,
                                      com.wm.data.IData... records)
        Returns a formatted string produced by formatting each given record using the specified pattern and arguments, separated by the given separator string.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale to apply during formatting. If null then no localization is applied.
        pattern - A format string, as per http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/Formatter.html.
        arguments - The list of arguments to be fetched from each record and normalized to the specified types.
        pipeline - The pipeline against which absolute argument keys are resolved.
        recordSeparator - An optional string for separating each formatted record in the resulting string.
        records - An IData[] document list where each item contains a set of argument values.
        Returns:
        A formatted string.

      • nullify

        public static java.lang.String nullify(java.lang.String input)
        Returns null if the given string only contains whitespace characters.
        Parameters:
        input - The string to be nullified.
        Returns:
        Null if the given string only contains whitespace characters, otherwise the given string unmodified.

        public static java.lang.String nullify(java.lang.String input,
                                       boolean nullify)
        Returns null if the given string only contains whitespace characters.
        Parameters:
        input - The string to be nullified.
        nullify - If true, the string will be nullified.
        Returns:
        Null if the given string only contains whitespace characters, otherwise the given string unmodified.

        Returns:
        The nullified list of strings.

                                      int count)

        Parameters:
        atom - A string to be repeated.
        count - The number of times to repeat the string.
        Returns:

      • legalize

        public static java.lang.String legalize(java.lang.String input)
        Converts the given identifier name to a legal Java identifier by replacing illegal characters with underscores.
        Parameters:
        input - The string to be converted.
        Returns:
        The given string converted to a legal Java identifier.

      • wrap

        public static java.lang.String[] wrap(java.lang.String input,
                                      int length)
        Wraps the given string at the given character width, returning an array of strings containing each line.
        Parameters:
        input - The string to be wrapped.
        length - The number of characters allowed per line.
        Returns:
        An array of strings containing each resulting line.

      • uncontrol

        public static java.lang.String uncontrol(java.lang.String input)
        Removes all ISO control characters from the given string. A character is considered to be an ISO control character if its code is in the range '␀' through '' or in the range '' through '?'.
        Parameters:
        input - The string to remove control characters from.
        Returns:
        The given string with all control characters removed.

      • uncontrol

        public static com.wm.data.IData uncontrol(com.wm.data.IData document)
        Removes all ISO control characters from all string values in the given IData document. A character is considered to be an ISO control character if its code is in the range '␀' through '' or in the range '' through '?'.
        Parameters:
        document - The IData document to process.
        Returns:
        A new IData document whose string values contain no control characters.

      • uncontrol

        public static com.wm.data.IData[] uncontrol(com.wm.data.IData[] array)
        Removes all ISO control characters from all string values in the given IData document. A character is considered to be an ISO control character if its code is in the range '␀' through '' or in the range '' through '?'.
        Parameters:
        array - The IData[] document list to process.
        Returns:
        A new IData[] document list whose string values contain no control characters.
